title: Drawing, "New York 1939 World's Fair: Perfume Industries Building, Mural Design", 1939
medium: Brush and blue, brown, black, yellow and green gouache, graphite, collaged magazine image on illustration board
markings: Donald Deskey stamp in black, lower right margin:  Donald Deskey/630 Fifth Avenue/New York City
description: Perspective view of a plaza, with a brown arched wall running diagonally from the lower left corner, on a turquoise, squared floor.  The wall dead-ends at center of sheet on a chartreuse horizontal wall, behind which is a purple, silo-shaped building.  In the center of the plaza is a glass-domed vitrine holding a three-quarter length dressmaker's form, topped by a floral wreath; there is a measuring tape around the neck and an inscription "Schaperel... " [sic] around the hips.  To the right is a grassy area with a dead tree viewed against a deep blue sky.
